title: Coesia Group to Showcase Sustainable Packaging, Automation Solutions at PACK EXPO - Packaging Strategies
summary: Coesia, a group of industrial and packaging solutions companies, is showcasing its latest sustainability and automation solutions at PACK EXPO Las Vegas.  The company's GREENMATION initiative focuses on reusable and recyclable packaging solutions, addressing consumer demands and manufacturer challenges. Coesia is highlighting two new innovations: FlexLink's BRIXX, a click-and-play solution for automating packing processes, and R.A Jones' Intelligent Flexible Transfer System (iFTS), a combination of flexible and hard automation for optimizing production needs.

title: Ball Aerosol Packaging releases new report on innovative Eyeris® printing technology for sustainable aluminum ... - Ball
summary: Ball Corporation, a leader in sustainable aluminum packaging, has launched Eyeris®, a new printing technology for aluminum cans and bottles. Eyeris® allows for high-resolution, photorealistic images that enhance product appeal and differentiate brands. The technology combines with the inherent sustainability of aluminum packaging, offering brands a way to stand out on crowded shelves while promoting environmental responsibility.

title: Honoring eco-friendly action: About the 2023 Sustainable Beauty Awards - CosmeticsDesign.com USA
summary: The Sustainable Beauty Awards, hosted by Ecovia Intelligence, recognize companies pushing sustainability in the beauty industry. The Awards, now in their 11th year, honor brands, ingredient firms, packaging suppliers, and other entities leading in sustainability.  The awards ceremony will take place in Paris on October 30th, with finalists announced on October 13th.

title: European Commission Adopts Measures Restricting Intentional Microplastics - Cosmetics & Toiletries
summary: The European Commission has adopted new regulations restricting microplastics in products, aiming to reduce environmental pollution.  The measures prohibit the sale of microplastics, products containing intentionally added microplastics, and products releasing such microplastics during use.  Exceptions and transition periods are in place for affected parties to adapt to the new rules.

title: Giants lead green packaging future - Vietnam Investment Review
summary: The article discusses the growing trend of sustainable packaging in Vietnam's food and beverage industry. Foreign companies are leading the charge in implementing green packaging solutions, including reducing plastic use, using recycled materials, and promoting circularity. The Vietnamese government is also supporting the transition to sustainable packaging by enacting regulations that encourage eco-friendly practices.

summary: Neutrogena has launched a new waterless, refillable cleanser that uses a concentrate powder to create foam when mixed with water. title: Subtle Energies rings in 30th anniversary with new Biotechnology Skincare range and packaging overhaul ... - Spa Business
summary: Subtle Energies, an Australian skincare brand celebrating its 30th anniversary, has launched a new Biotechnology Skincare range and a refreshed packaging design. title: Amcor research shows strong demand for own brand food - FoodManufacture.co.uk
summary: A survey of over 3,000 shoppers in Europe found that price and promotions are the main drivers for choosing own brand products over branded alternatives.  While price is a key factor, 51% of respondents will continue to buy own brand products due to their quality.  Consumers also increasingly expect both private label and branded products to be produced and packaged sustainably.

title: CEFLEX Teams up with Recyda to Facilitate Sustainable Design Check Tool - Packaging Strategies
summary: CEFLEX, an organization promoting circular economy for flexible packaging, has launched a free online tool called 'Design Check' to help companies assess the recyclability of their packaging designs. This tool, developed in collaboration with Recyda, allows users to input information about their packaging structure and receive feedback on its compatibility with the CEFLEX guidelines for sortability and recyclability. The tool aims to simplify the design process and promote the development of more sustainable packaging solutions.

title: Molpack, HP Team Up to Revolutionize Molded Fiber Production in Latin America - Packaging Strategies
summary: Molpack Corporation, a leading molded fiber packaging provider in Latin America, has partnered with HP to digitize and transform the industrial production of molded fiber products. This collaboration aims to reduce CO2 emissions and replace single-use plastics with more sustainable packaging solutions, specifically focusing on fruit trays and other commodity products made from recycled paper. The partnership utilizes HP's Molded Fiber Advanced Tooling Solution, which optimizes manufacturing processes, delivers high-quality products with enhanced performance, and reduces the carbon footprint during tooling and part production.
